primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in a hopeless, sin-bound world to establish an eternal kingdom through the Incarnation, reversing the exile from Eden.

tekstueel_bewijs: God is the one who rules over the everlasting kingdom
God has acted. God has intervened.
The Holy Spirit will come upon you

object.identificatie: The Incarnation / The New Creation / Salvation
tekstueel_bewijs: the one who will save his people from their sins
a kingdom of joy and delight where no disappointment can ever enter
the angel Gabriel was sent from God

ontvanger.identificatie: The Human Race / Mary / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: who for us men and for our salvation came down from heaven
Mary was just as helpless as Joseph to make this happen
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the helpless Receiver of a divine act.

helper.identificatie: Gabriel / The Virgin Mary / The Evangelists
tekstueel_bewijs: Mary was just as helpless... The human impossibility is overcome by the irresistible power of God.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; the Spirit is the Power (Pouvoir).
helper.rol_van_geest: The Spirit is the internal 'Pouvoir-faire' of the miracle.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin / Death / Human Incapacity / The 'Fountains of Blood'
tekstueel_bewijs: the human race is utterly incapable of turning itself around
the angel who drove Adam and Eve out of Paradise
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but an ontological 'incapacity' and 'sin' that requires a 'mighty reversal' by God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Humanity's attempt to create 'magic' or peace through commercialism, art, or social effort.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Human Race / The Preacher
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is shown to fail completely (incapacity), necessitating the primary program (God's intervention).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is the one who rules.
Only God can create a new kingdom.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The human race is utterly incapable.

voorbeelden: we need to recognize very clearly
even though we know, we know there isn’t [magic]
the human race is utterly incapable
with God, nothing will be impossible

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is centered on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God in the face of human 'Non-pouvoir' (Incapacity). This is the hallmark of a grace-oriented sermon.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at ~S1 (fake magic), moves to S2 (real horror/sin), then to ~S2 (human incapacity), and finally to S1 (God's New Thing).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's 'mighty reversal'—He enters the world directly because humanity cannot move from S2 to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; sin is described as a cosmic power and a fountain of blood.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly rejects human agency as the source of salvation and places God as the sole Subject of the 'New Thing'.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has acted. God has intervened.
the human race is utterly incapable of turning itself around

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Mary is not presented as a model of faith to imitate, but as a 'helpless' recipient of God's power.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Mary is the site of God's sovereign action.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'fixing the world' is removed and replaced by God's promise.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'fake magic' of the world to the 'real magic' of the Incarnation is logically and narratively seamless.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the part where evil is defeated conclusively and forever... the phantoms banished

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' that humanity lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total depravity/incapacity in the face of sin.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject, the world is the Receiver, and Sin is the Opponent.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for an Advent/Christmas context.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon avoids every pitfall of moralism by relentlessly making God the Subject of the action and humanity the helpless but beloved beneficiary.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'magic' metaphor; Greimas shows that the 'magic' is actually a functional placeholder for Divine Agency.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the text; Greimas explains how the sermon's 'engine' drives the hearer toward dependence on God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'reversal' is not just a theme but a structural shift in the Actantial Subject from Man to God.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Fleming Rutledge's own criteria perfectly.
